questions.question: What is the main grammatical difference between Series II (Aorist) and Series III (Perfect)?

options.text: Series II is for present, Series III is for future
Series II uses simple past, Series III uses auxiliary verbs + main verb
Series II is formal, Series III is informal

questions.explanation: The key structural difference is that Series III uses auxiliary verb + main verb combination, while Series II uses simple conjugated forms.

questions.question: When should you use Perfect tense instead of Aorist?

options.text: When talking about actions in the distant past
When the action is completed but still relevant to the present
When the action hasn't happened yet

questions.explanation: Perfect tense is used when an action is completed but has present relevance or connection to the current moment.

questions.question: Complete: დავასრულედმიყავ საშინაოდრო, როცა მასწავლებელი ______ (I had finished homework when the teacher arrived)
questions.explanation: The teacher's arrival is in simple past (Aorist: მოვიდა) to contrast with the Pluperfect 'had finished'.

questions.question: What is the Perfect first person form of ხედვა (to see)?
questions.explanation: ვნახიყავ is the Perfect form with the perfect stem ნახ and auxiliary ending იყავ.

questions.question: When should you use Pluperfect tense?

options.text: When one past action happened before another past action

questions.explanation: Pluperfect (also called Past Perfect) sequences past events, showing which happened first.

questions.question: Match each verb to its correct series classification
questions.explanation: Each series has distinct forms: Series I for present/future, Series II for simple past, Series III for perfect aspect.

questions.question: What is the Perfect third person form of წერა (to write)?
questions.explanation: დაწერიყვის uses the perfect stem დაწერ plus the third person auxiliary ending იყვის.

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses Perfect tense?
questions.explanation: Option b correctly uses Perfect to show a completed action (seeing the movie) that has present relevance (feeling about it now).

questions.question: Complete: ვნახედმიყავ ფილმი, _____ _____ ჩავედი (I had seen the movie before you arrived)
questions.explanation: სანამ (before) is the correct temporal conjunction to show the order of past events with Pluperfect.

questions.question: What aspect does Series III express?
questions.explanation: Series III expresses perfect aspect, where actions are completed but still hold relevance to the discourse context.
